intro: Ventilago bracteata, commonly known as the silver bract verbena, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Verbenaceae and is characterized by its silver-gray, hairy leaves and clusters of small, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. Its flowers are often visited by pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Ventilago bracteata is also valued for its ornamental appeal and drought tolerance.
